And this will be an opportunity for me to remind our friends at the table that this is the call of our time and that we have an opportunity to write a hopeful chapter here in DATE and to thank people around the table for understanding this is the call of the time, because there is been a lot of constructive engagement and good work, all aimed at protecting ourselves from short-term attack-in the short term from attack and recognizing that changing conditions of life in the long term will enable us to live in peace. And finally, I am looking forward to reminding people that I take the climate change issue seriously; that we recognize that there needs to be international-an international accord to get people at the table who are the major emitters to set a goal. Step CARDINAL to solving a problem is to set the goal on what we ought to achieve. If you want somebody to be a part of the problem-a part of the solution, you need to let them be a part of defining what the goal ought to be. So many of the people at the ORG table are going to come to the major economy conference that-those of us who are emitters will be there, including GPE, which will be at the table. I do not want to single GPE out, but GPE has got a major role to play. Any agreement without GPE is not going to be an effective agreement. So my strategy has been to get GPE at the table. We will further the dialog. PERSON has got some very interesting ways to further the dialog in a constructive way, particularly talking about energy usage. So we will be looking forward to his leadership on the issue. When I told him I was looking forward to coming, we discussed this issue. He is concerned about greenhouse gases. And so he will take the lead here at the conference, and GPE will play a constructive role. We have got a big agenda. It is my second trip to GPE. I remind people that GPE-parts of GPE reminds me of GPE--and there is no higher compliment. I think on behalf of all of us, I can say thank you very much for this opportunity DATE. As you have just analyzed, ENTITY, obviously GPE and the Middle East, the war on terror is an overarching policy issue for the PERSON administration. Nonetheless, there has been a perception in the region that this has distracted GPE from engagement in Asia. Some people are calling this the Pacific DATE. You are cutting short your trip to GPE because of the GPE issue. I am just wondering, do you think that is warranted, that criticism, and do you see GPE, for instance, playing the role-the driver in DATE, not the GPE? No, it is interesting, first of all, this administration has got good bilateral relations with GPE, good bilateral relations with GPE, good bilateral relations with GPE. Our relationship with the ORG countries are as strong as GPE has ever been, and of course our ties with GPE are tight, really tight. And the reason I say that is, is that this just does not happen without work. And I have worked hard to develop bilateral relations in such a way that we can achieve strategic objectives. I believe the relations with GPE and the Asian-Pacific region have never been better, and as a result, we are addressing problems and creating opportunities. CARDINAL problem, of course, is GPE. When I came into office, the world was expecting GPE to solve the GPE issue alone. To me-and the NORP leader had basically not honored the bilateral agreement that had been struck, and therefore, felt like we needed to put this issue in a position in which others were speaking besides GPE-and have started the CARDINAL-party talks. CARDINAL countries were convinced to come to the table on CARDINAL side to convince the NORP leader to give up his nuclear weapons ambitions. That would not have happened without engagement and good, solid relations. Another issue obviously is our bilateral relations with GPE. It is the same-you are in a little different position in that you have got a nice trade surplus with GPE. We have got a trade deficit with GPE. And it is important for us to have a-given the complexity of our relationship, that we have got a strategic relationship that allows for engagement and for us to help deal with a major trade deficit, for example, and/or product safety or a SARS outbreak. Secretary PERSON-I empowered Secretary PERSON to develop this special working relationship with GPE. And it requires a lot of engagement. It requires engagement at the top, with President PERSON, who I respect, as well as people in my ORG. For those who argue that, they really have not -frankly have not followed how engaged we have been. Is GPE an issue for the world? But I do not view it as a negative issue; I view it as an opportunity to work with a-one of the really significantly growing economies in the world. First, I view that a growing middle class in GPE is good for GPE exporters. It provides opportunity. And it is -by the way, it is not only good for GPE exports; it is good for NORP exporters, and it is good for NORP exporters, and it is good for NORP, NORP. Anybody who is making a product somebody wants, it is just a good opportunity. And so as a part of our engagement with GPE, we have worked with PERSON to convince him to help convert his economy from one of savers to one of consumers, which means-and by the way, that takes a lot of effort and work to get in a position where you can even make those kind of constructive suggestions-which means the development of a pension system or health care, so that people do not feel like they have to hoard their money to save for a rainy day, but in fact, there is some kind of safety net that is predictable, which then would convert a NORP person who is beginning to realize better income into a consumer. And then all of a sudden, you have got consumers, which provide opportunity. Huge economic opportunity-you see GPE as the big grower of the economy in the Asia Pacific? No, I see GPE as the big driver for trade. At ORG, people ought to be wondering whether or not PERSON is going to keep taxes low to make sure our economy continues to grow, because we are a significant trading partner. I view GPE as an opportunity. I think GPE is going to drive a lot of the trade. That is why we conducted-now, having said that, I think GPE will provide opportunity for NORP producers, but we also provide the same opportunity. I do not view it as a CARDINAL-sum game, let me put it to you that way. I view it as an-I view-all of us contribute, so long as the world does not slip into protectionism. And part of the reason one goes to ORG is to promote trade and opportunity. And how do you plan to win the hearts and win the markets in the world, including in NORP countries like GPE? Well, I think, first of all, we have a complex relationship with GPE. GPE strongly supports markets. On the other hand, we also support open societies, transparency, where people are allowed to express themselves in a free society. I believe in freedom of religion. I believe in basic freedoms. So our relationship with GPE is, on the CARDINAL hand, we welcome trading opportunities. And what makes the relationship even more complex is, at the same time, we believe in human rights and human dignity. And we worked with the NORP leadership to promote human rights and human dignity. So it is not-it is hard to define the relationship in kind of a simple, CARDINAL-sentence structure. As I told you, I view GPE as a positive opportunity. I like him; I like to talk to him. We can share issues together. And he can say to me, What are your problems? In other words, we have got a personal relationship. And that is the way I try to do with all leaders because the best diplomacy is when you can sit down with somebody one on CARDINAL and speak candidly about issues and problems. See, that is what leaders do. You see problems and you anticipate problems and work together to accomplish something. I have also got a very good relationship with your leader. And so bilateral relations-first of all, in the NORP world, it is very important for people to understand that the war on terror is not a war against NORP; it is a war against murderers. I do not believe religious people, truly religious people kill the innocent. And therefore, it is important for leaders and countries to work together to prevent the murder of the innocent and, at the same time, make sure that we respect-GPE, in my case, respects religion, values the right for people to worship, and, in the case of ORG, values ORG as an important part of the international scene in the world we live in. Yes, well, I am better for it. I have a question on GPE. Is it possible that GPE will give up nuclear weapons program by the end of your term? And to help achieve it, are you ready to remove GPE from the State Sponsors of Terrorism list, even without the resolution of NORP abductee issue? As to the first part of your question, I certainly hope that GPE honors its agreements. They-in DATE, they made a substantial agreement to disclose and dismantle all aspects of a nuclear weapons program. And here we are in DATE, DATE, where we are still reminding them of that agreement. On the other hand, a lot has happened in DATE that would lead me to believe that we are on- we are making progress. And we will continue to push toward the full disclosure and dismantlement. Secondly, we have-different aspects of our relationship are on the table, but it is performance based. In other words, we expect people to honor their agreements. Finally, as I assured Prime Minister PERSON, that we are not going to forget the abductee issue. He and the NORP people are very concerned that once certain aspects of the agreement are achieved, that we will forget the fact that NORP citizens have been abducted. ENTITY. I will never forget the meeting I had with the mother-it is very important for your readers to know that that had a deep impression on me- the mother whose daughter was abducted by NORP. I cannot imagine what that would mean. I guess I can imagine what it would mean; I just cannot understand, fully understand the pain that she felt-still feels. And I will never forget her coming to FAC with the picture of that little girl, picture of her daughter who got abducted. She sat right there in FAC. And my point to you is, is that I am not going to forget the mother or forget the fact. And so we will work with the-continue to work with the NORP to make it clear to NORP that we also expect there to be resolution to this issue. In other words, I understand, as well as I possibly can, the emotion that people attach to this issue. But now that I am DATE, it is not that old. It is all in your mind. Sir, your administration has indicated interest to appoint a special envoy to the ORG of Islamic Conference, or the ORG. Have you identified the person? And what will he or she do to bridge relations with the NORP countries in the NORP world, in light of the war in GPE and in light of the detention of extremists from NORP countries? First of all, we have not identified the person yet. We are working toward that end. As a matter of fact, I spoke to the Secretary of ORG about this TIME, coincidentally enough. Anyway, we are working the issue. Secondly, the reason why I suggested- or announced that we are going to do this is because I am concerned about the perceptions in the NORP world that GPE views the war on terror as a war against a particular religion. And I just explained to you that this is a war of extremists and radicals, ideologues driven by a vision that is not-that hijacks religion in order to justify their position. And any chance we have to dispel false notion and to reinforce the realities is helpful to GPE and frankly others as well. And so that is the reason to name the envoy. It also is a clear signal that we respect nations and that we treat the NORP world seriously. And you can do that all different kinds of ways. It is another moment for people to see the seriousness of intent. In terms of-murder is murder, and murder to achieve political objectives is-needs to be stopped. People murdered NORP to achieve a political objective. There is a debate in our country whether that is true or not. I have made up my mind. I believe it is absolutely fundamentally true because I am listening to what the enemy says, the enemy of freedom, what they are saying. They say, We want a caliphate, we want to spread our vision. It took a military action, by the way, to liberate people from that vision in GPE. This was not an attack on ORG; this was an attack for liberty. Think about a society in which you CARDINAL could not function in what you are doing because of your gender. Because the vision of these people-who murder the innocent, by the way, to achieve their vision-is that women are not equal. And it just so happened that, given the way the world is DATE, that that kind of ideologue provided safe haven for people who plotted and killed people in our country. CARDINAL, I am not going to stand for it; I am going to protect GPE, just like any other leader would protect their own country. And CARDINAL, CARDINAL way to achieve long-term peace is to help people realize forms of government that give hope. And so whether it be in GPE and GPE, we are helping people realize the blessings of freedom. Freedom yields peace. Forms of government matter. And so the ambassador to the ORG or the President or any other representative of GPE will be expressing this deep desire to work together to achieve peace. ENTITY, what do you think you have achieved with regards to GPE ties with Asia during your time in office? In other words, we are making progress. The first step was to get people to the table, to remind people that it is just not GPE with responsibility. The purpose of the-getting all QUANTITY of us to the table is so that if GPE tried to say, Well, I am really-I said I was going to do it, but I am not going to do it, then there is somebody else also saying, And here are the consequences. And now it is beginning to work because they are verifiably beginning to shut down the reactor. And so we have got more to do. Unfinished is kind of a loaded word, in a way. But I am not-we are not in control of- we are in control of putting the process in place and making sure it is consequential if somebody does not go forward. But it is the leader of GPE who gets to the make the decision. I have made my choice. Let me reiterate a little bit of what I said earlier. The definition of successful foreign policy is to be in a position to work with others to solve problems. And this administration has worked hard to be in a position to convince others to work together to solve problems. I have just outlined some of the problems, some of the problems-whether or not trade is open and people are treated fairly. CARDINAL classic example of this is intellectual property rights. I know that is a deep concern to your Government, just like it is to all our governments, that if you are trading with a country, you want to make sure that those intellectual property rights are treated respectfully. And in some societies, it is difficult. And therefore, we have to be in a position to work collaboratively and bilaterally to convince countries that in order to be a part of the international world, you have to honor contract. And CARDINAL contract is, you do not steal somebody else's intellectual property. But nevertheless, those kind of relationships exist now; we are able to have those kind of dialogs. There is been a lot of cooperation on the security front in remarkable ways since I have been President. The leadership of your country knows full well the dangers of extremism prevailing and have been very strong in working, for example, on the Proliferation Security Initiative. This is an initiative where many ORG nations have agreed to help find and stop the shipment of materiels which could end up in the hands of extremists and radicals that could harm us. And it took a while to get this relationship in place. But it is a relationship that is necessary to help prevent weapons of mass destruction from being moved. And here is a classic case of a successful collaborative effort. The biggest danger we have, it seems like to me, is isolationism and protectionism becoming prevalent philosophies. CARDINAL of the things that this administration has done in working with our friends is to work hard to explain to people the beneficial nature of trading together. And therefore-and that is manifested, by the way, in, for example, the free trade agreement with GPE, which was not a given. And there were some difficulties to overcome in GPE and in GPE, but nevertheless, we got it done. And entering into free trade agreements with other nations, such as GPE, has been good ways of making sure that we codify the benefits of open trading relationships. And so there is been a lot of progress made, and the NORP issue is the issue that we are spending a lot of time on and, hopefully, we can get completed. Just to the domestic scene, we have got Federal elections, as you know, coming up in GPE. Last time around, you had some comments with regards to the then opposition leader's policies on GPE. You described his policy of withdrawal from GPE as disastrous. You have a one-on-CARDINAL meeting with the opposition leader, PERSON; he is ahead in the polls. He is also got a policy in GPE which talks about withdrawal, albeit with caveats. I am just wondering, what is your view of the opposition leader, PERSON? What will you discuss in the meeting? And what do you make of his GPE policy? Yes, first of all, I think it makes sense for me to reach out to leading political figures when I go to other countries. And so I am looking forward to this meeting. I do not know much about him, frankly. Obviously, I have not -maybe I met him; I do not remember meeting him. When I spoke to the Parliament-- I am going to remind him that, CARDINAL, the stakes in GPE are very high for peace; that the liberation of a country-that country was important for peace; and that a democracy-NORP-style democracy in the heart of the Middle East is part of winning this ideological struggle. So the first thing I am going to do is explain to him my views about this-the world in which we live. And I will remind him that, as far as I am concerned, that leaving GPE before the job is done will cause an enemy that attacked us before to become emboldened. And as PERSON put it, to think the enemy will stay there and not follow us here is- in other words, we leave before the job is done, they will follow us home. That-I will remind him that the best way to conduct policy is based upon conditions on the ground; that success is important; that conditions ought to be driving troop deployments. And that is how-I will tell him how-what I would hope all our coalition partners would view the situation in GPE and GPE. Having said that, I do appreciate very much the fact that the NORP have sacrificed and have served. And I am looking forward to seeing some NORP troops with Prime Minister PERSON to thank them and, as importantly, thank their families for joining GPE and a lot of other countries in the great cause of liberation and peace. It is going to be an interesting trip, and what is interesting about these trips is that the time around the table with leaders is important, but also the time sitting down with individuals is important as well. It is a good opportunity to conduct foreign policy. And as I told you, a lot of foreign policy, for me, is the capacity to just look at somebody in the eye and tell them what I think and listen to what they think. It is finding that common ground, if possible, to solve problems. And sometimes you can solve problems by anticipating them and putting the conditions in place so that they will not arise in the first place. And sometimes they just show up, and you better be in a position to deal with them. Can I just clarify something? PERSON is-his theater-he is talked about the importance of GPE, talking about withdrawing our troops from GPE. That he is determined to-he has determined that the issue on Afghanistan- to keep troops in GPE. I view both GPE and GPE as theaters of the same war against radicals and extremists and look forward to sharing my views with Mr. PERSON, of course, and continue our discussions, strategic discussions with PERSON. My next question would touch on NORP cleric PERSON. As you might know, since he was released from jail, has been exercising activities like any other citizens, including recently-DATE he inaugurated a long march participated by CARDINAL of his followers, in connection with that commemoration, or welcoming DATE NORP fasting DATE. Actually, how close has your Government monitored the activities of PERSON? First of all, I did not know he led a parade of CARDINAL people. So that may answer your first question. I am sure our Embassy is aware of the activities that take place in your country. I mean, you are a free country where people are allowed to express themselves in the public square, which is a sign of a healthy society. I am concerned, however, about anybody who preaches violence and extremism and radicalism in a world in which innocent people just get simply murdered for ideological purposes. There were some terrible murders in your country, as you know, just like in mine, and I am confident that by far the vast majority-all of GPE rejects that kind of behavior. Innocent people were killed in GPE for no other reason than they just happened to be vacationing and because somebody wanted to send a political message because they are involved with this ideological struggle. And those of us who want there to be peace have got to reject this kind of behavior. And so your Government is a government of law; your Government will conduct itself according to your laws. But anybody who preaches that kind of violence in the name of what I would call a dark political vision needs to be taken seriously. My next question is about the GPE relationship and the war on terror. The opposition party in GPE is threatening to cut the extension of NORP participation in the antiterrorism operations in the Indian Ocean. Are you concerned about that? And will you be-will you raise this issue when you will meet Prime Minister PERSON in GPE? First of all, GPE has been a positive contributor to dealing with the extremists in this ideological war. And I thank ORG and the people of GPE for their contributions. And I would hope that they would continue to maintain this-their positive influence. And of course, my conversations with Prime Minister PERSON, whom I respect a great deal, will center on the war on terror, as well as a lot of other key issues. GPE has played a significant role in many of the things we have discussed here, like Proliferation Security Initiative, CARDINAL-party talks. They have been a constructive partner in peace, and I will-we will talk about all aspects of our relationship. ENTITY, DATE,GPE celebrates its 50th-- Fiftieth-make sure my congratulatory remarks get in your article. PERSON Congratulates GPE. Do you think that is what it will say? It also marks the 50th relations between the GPE and GPE So what are your outlook and hopes for GPE relations, and especially with GPE being the 10th largest trading partner? First of all, I do believe we ought to have-take this notion of trade and have meaningful discussions with a potential free trade agreement with GPE. Secondly, I respect Prime Minister PERSON, admire his leadership. When his wife died, I tried to call him early just to let him know I cared about him. I will congratulate him. Do not put that in the article, that you had to tell me that. You can put it in there if you want. I will be glad to-I am going to congratulate him. You did congratulate him. I am going to congratulate him again. I will double the congratulations. That is right; I did write him a note. Did I call him or write him a note? You wrote him a note. Anyway, GPE is an interesting example of how a free society can deal with movements that could conceivably change and alter the nature of the free society. And I respect the way the Prime Minister has used freedom and used the openness of society to kind of deal with frustration. I mean, all societies have frustrated people. And the question is, will the outlet of that frustration lead to violence or lead to peace? And GPE is an example of a country where frustrations have been channeled in a constructive way. And therefore, he is a leader, as far as I am concerned, and a very constructive force for Southeast Asia. By the way, I am going to meet with the ORG leaders, which is an important meeting as well. It is an opportunity for GPE to stay very much engaged with ORG. I unfortunately will not be there for the 60th, but look forward to having an event that would kind of recognize the importance of ORG as far as GPE is concerned. So this is a side meeting with the ORG leaders after ORG meeting, sir? I try to do that every time. So they will have somebody like-I will sit down and meet with the ORG nations as well. The other thing that is interesting about GPE is, they are going to be one of the leaders on alternative fuels. I believe that it is in our interests that we develop the technologies necessary to deal with energy dependence as well as greenhouse gases. Back to the climate changes-the way-if you are truly interested in dealing with greenhouse gases, people need to focus on the development of technologies that will enable us to, on the CARDINAL hand, grow our economies, on the other hand, be good stewards of the environment. Just for the record-and this probably will not be a headline, although I have tried to make it one a lot-when it comes time to climate change, there is CARDINAL major industrialized nation that actually grew its economy and reduced greenhouse gases; that would be GPE that actually had greenhouse gases go down and the economy go up. So something is working here, and it is technologies, use of technologies. And so I am going to be reminding people about-that we can come up with a strategy that does not impoverish our people and, at the same time, takes advantage of technologies. And we are going to need to share some technologies with newly emerging economies in order to achieve this objective. Anyway, I forgot to make that point. I am not making the point to you, as you can tell. That is why I am kind of looking over your shoulder. There appears to be a perception in Southeast Asia that this administration has neglected the region. How do you plan to convince them otherwise when you meet in ORG? Well, I-do you want to ask another question, because I already answered it. I will be glad to answer it again- which is, we have got strong bilateral-first of all, the number of trips I have taken- I have gone to every ORG meeting. I have spent a lot of time with leaders both here and in your respective countries-that we have got relations to a point where we can work together to solve common problems. PSI is CARDINAL such example of a strategy we have implemented to deal with the realities of the world. And so it is -the truth of the matter is, I spend a lot of time working on NORP matters. And all I will ask you to do is look at the results of the individual relationships and the ability to put processes in place to deal with the threats we live in and the capacity to work together to solve problems and to create opportunities. And to me, that is a sign of a healthy, robust relationship with an important part of the world.

It requires engagement at the top, with President PERSON, who I respect, as well as people in my ORG. But I do not view it as a negative issue; I view it as an opportunity to work with a-one of the really significantly growing economies in the world. First, I view that a growing middle class in GPE is good for GPE exporters. It provides opportunity. And it is -by the way, it is not only good for GPE exports; it is good for NORP exporters, and it is good for NORP exporters, and it is good for NORP, NORP. Anybody who is making a product somebody wants, it is just a good opportunity. And so as a part of our engagement with GPE, we have worked with PERSON to convince him to help convert his economy from one of savers to one of consumers, which means-and by the way, that takes a lot of effort and work to get in a position where you can even make those kind of constructive suggestions-which means the development of a pension system or health care, so that people do not feel like they have to hoard their money to save for a rainy day, but in fact, there is some kind of safety net that is predictable, which then would convert a NORP person who is beginning to realize better income into a consumer. And then all of a sudden, you have got consumers, which provide opportunity. Huge economic opportunity-you see GPE as the big grower of the economy in the Asia Pacific? No, I see GPE as the big driver for trade. At ORG, people ought to be wondering whether or not PERSON is going to keep taxes low to make sure our economy continues to grow, because we are a significant trading partner. I view GPE as an opportunity. I think GPE is going to drive a lot of the trade. That is why we conducted-now, having said that, I think GPE will provide opportunity for NORP producers, but we also provide the same opportunity. I do not view it as a CARDINAL-sum game, let me put it to you that way. I view it as an-I view-all of us contribute, so long as the world does not slip into protectionism. And part of the reason one goes to ORG is to promote trade and opportunity. And how do you plan to win the hearts and win the markets in the world, including in NORP countries like GPE? Well, I think, first of all, we have a complex relationship with GPE. GPE strongly supports markets. On the other hand, we also support open societies, transparency, where people are allowed to express themselves in a free society. I believe in freedom of religion. I believe in basic freedoms. So our relationship with GPE is, on the CARDINAL hand, we welcome trading opportunities. And what makes the relationship even more complex is, at the same time, we believe in human rights and human dignity. And we worked with the NORP leadership to promote human rights and human dignity. So it is not-it is hard to define the relationship in kind of a simple, CARDINAL-sentence structure. As I told you, I view GPE as a positive opportunity. I like him; I like to talk to him. We can share issues together. And he can say to me, What are your problems? In other words, we have got a personal relationship. And that is the way I try to do with all leaders because the best diplomacy is when you can sit down with somebody one on CARDINAL and speak candidly about issues and problems. See, that is what leaders do. You see problems and you anticipate problems and work together to accomplish something. I have also got a very good relationship with your leader. And so bilateral relations-first of all, in the NORP world, it is very important for people to understand that the war on terror is not a war against NORP; it is a war against murderers. I do not believe religious people, truly religious people kill the innocent. And therefore, it is important for leaders and countries to work together to prevent the murder of the innocent and, at the same time, make sure that we respect-GPE, in my case, respects religion, values the right for people to worship, and, in the case of ORG, values ORG as an important part of the international scene in the world we live in. Yes, well, I am better for it. I have a question on GPE. Is it possible that GPE will give up nuclear weapons program by the end of your term? And to help achieve it, are you ready to remove GPE from the State Sponsors of Terrorism list, even without the resolution of NORP abductee issue? As to the first part of your question, I certainly hope that GPE honors its agreements. They-in DATE, they made a substantial agreement to disclose and dismantle all aspects of a nuclear weapons program. And here we are in DATE, DATE, where we are still reminding them of that agreement. On the other hand, a lot has happened in DATE that would lead me to believe that we are on- we are making progress. And we will continue to push toward the full disclosure and dismantlement. Secondly, we have-different aspects of our relationship are on the table, but it is performance based. In other words, we expect people to honor their agreements. Finally, as I assured Prime Minister PERSON, that we are not going to forget the abductee issue. He and the NORP people are very concerned that once certain aspects of the agreement are achieved, that we will forget the fact that NORP citizens have been abducted. ENTITY. I will never forget the meeting I had with the mother-it is very important for your readers to know that that had a deep impression on me- the mother whose daughter was abducted by NORP. I cannot imagine what that would mean. I guess I can imagine what it would mean; I just cannot understand, fully understand the pain that she felt-still feels. And I will never forget her coming to FAC with the picture of that little girl, picture of her daughter who got abducted. She sat right there in FAC. And my point to you is, is that I am not going to forget the mother or forget the fact. And so we will work with the-continue to work with the NORP to make it clear to NORP that we also expect there to be resolution to this issue. In other words, I understand, as well as I possibly can, the emotion that people attach to this issue. But now that I am DATE, it is not that old. It is all in your mind. Sir, your administration has indicated interest to appoint a special envoy to the ORG of Islamic Conference, or the ORG. Have you identified the person? And what will he or she do to bridge relations with the NORP countries in the NORP world, in light of the war in GPE and in light of the detention of extremists from NORP countries? First of all, we have not identified the person yet. We are working toward that end. As a matter of fact, I spoke to the Secretary of ORG about this TIME, coincidentally enough. Anyway, we are working the issue. Secondly, the reason why I suggested- or announced that we are going to do this is because I am concerned about the perceptions in the NORP world that GPE views the war on terror as a war against a particular religion. And I just explained to you that this is a war of extremists and radicals, ideologues driven by a vision that is not-that hijacks religion in order to justify their position. And any chance we have to dispel false notion and to reinforce the realities is helpful to GPE and frankly others as well. And so that is the reason to name the envoy. It also is a clear signal that we respect nations and that we treat the NORP world seriously. And you can do that all different kinds of ways. It is another moment for people to see the seriousness of intent. In terms of-murder is murder, and murder to achieve political objectives is-needs to be stopped. People murdered NORP to achieve a political objective. There is a debate in our country whether that is true or not. I have made up my mind. I believe it is absolutely fundamentally true because I am listening to what the enemy says, the enemy of freedom, what they are saying. They say, We want a caliphate, we want to spread our vision. It took a military action, by the way, to liberate people from that vision in GPE. This was not an attack on ORG; this was an attack for liberty. Think about a society in which you CARDINAL could not function in what you are doing because of your gender. Because the vision of these people-who murder the innocent, by the way, to achieve their vision-is that women are not equal. And it just so happened that, given the way the world is DATE, that that kind of ideologue provided safe haven for people who plotted and killed people in our country. CARDINAL, I am not going to stand for it; I am going to protect GPE, just like any other leader would protect their own country. And CARDINAL, CARDINAL way to achieve long-term peace is to help people realize forms of government that give hope. And so whether it be in GPE and GPE, we are helping people realize the blessings of freedom. Freedom yields peace. Forms of government matter. And so the ambassador to the ORG or the President or any other representative of GPE will be expressing this deep desire to work together to achieve peace. ENTITY, what do you think you have achieved with regards to GPE ties with Asia during your time in office? In other words, we are making progress. The first step was to get people to the table, to remind people that it is just not GPE with responsibility. The purpose of the-getting all QUANTITY of us to the table is so that if GPE tried to say, Well, I am really-I said I was going to do it, but I am not going to do it, then there is somebody else also saying, And here are the consequences. And now it is beginning to work because they are verifiably beginning to shut down the reactor. And so we have got more to do. Unfinished is kind of a loaded word, in a way. But I am not-we are not in control of- we are in control of putting the process in place and making sure it is consequential if somebody does not go forward. But it is the leader of GPE who gets to the make the decision. I have made my choice. Let me reiterate a little bit of what I said earlier. The definition of successful foreign policy is to be in a position to work with others to solve problems. And this administration has worked hard to be in a position to convince others to work together to solve problems. I have just outlined some of the problems, some of the problems-whether or not trade is open and people are treated fairly. CARDINAL classic example of this is intellectual property rights. I know that is a deep concern to your Government, just like it is to all our governments, that if you are trading with a country, you want to make sure that those intellectual property rights are treated respectfully. And in some societies, it is difficult. And therefore, we have to be in a position to work collaboratively and bilaterally to convince countries that in order to be a part of the international world, you have to honor contract. And CARDINAL contract is, you do not steal somebody else's intellectual property. But nevertheless, those kind of relationships exist now; we are able to have those kind of dialogs. There is been a lot of cooperation on the security front in remarkable ways since I have been President. The leadership of your country knows full well the dangers of extremism prevailing and have been very strong in working, for example, on the Proliferation Security Initiative. This is an initiative where many ORG nations have agreed to help find and stop the shipment of materiels which could end up in the hands of extremists and radicals that could harm us. And it took a while to get this relationship in place. But it is a relationship that is necessary to help prevent weapons of mass destruction from being moved. And here is a classic case of a successful collaborative effort. The biggest danger we have, it seems like to me, is isolationism and protectionism becoming prevalent philosophies. CARDINAL of the things that this administration has done in working with our friends is to work hard to explain to people the beneficial nature of trading together. And therefore-and that is manifested, by the way, in, for example, the free trade agreement with GPE, which was not a given. And there were some difficulties to overcome in GPE and in GPE, but nevertheless, we got it done. And entering into free trade agreements with other nations, such as GPE, has been good ways of making sure that we codify the benefits of open trading relationships. And so there is been a lot of progress made, and the NORP issue is the issue that we are spending a lot of time on and, hopefully, we can get completed. Just to the domestic scene, we have got Federal elections, as you know, coming up in GPE. Last time around, you had some comments with regards to the then opposition leader's policies on GPE. You described his policy of withdrawal from GPE as disastrous. You have a one-on-CARDINAL meeting with the opposition leader, PERSON; he is ahead in the polls. He is also got a policy in GPE which talks about withdrawal, albeit with caveats. I am just wondering, what is your view of the opposition leader, PERSON? What will you discuss in the meeting? And what do you make of his GPE policy? Yes, first of all, I think it makes sense for me to reach out to leading political figures when I go to other countries. And so I am looking forward to this meeting. I do not know much about him, frankly. Obviously, I have not -maybe I met him; I do not remember meeting him. When I spoke to the Parliament-- I am going to remind him that, CARDINAL, the stakes in GPE are very high for peace; that the liberation of a country-that country was important for peace; and that a democracy-NORP-style democracy in the heart of the Middle East is part of winning this ideological struggle. So the first thing I am going to do is explain to him my views about this-the world in which we live. And I will remind him that, as far as I am concerned, that leaving GPE before the job is done will cause an enemy that attacked us before to become emboldened. And as PERSON put it, to think the enemy will stay there and not follow us here is- in other words, we leave before the job is done, they will follow us home. That-I will remind him that the best way to conduct policy is based upon conditions on the ground; that success is important; that conditions ought to be driving troop deployments. And that is how-I will tell him how-what I would hope all our coalition partners would view the situation in GPE and GPE. Having said that, I do appreciate very much the fact that the NORP have sacrificed and have served. And I am looking forward to seeing some NORP troops with Prime Minister PERSON to thank them and, as importantly, thank their families for joining GPE and a lot of other countries in the great cause of liberation and peace. It is going to be an interesting trip, and what is interesting about these trips is that the time around the table with leaders is important, but also the time sitting down with individuals is important as well. It is a good opportunity to conduct foreign policy. And as I told you, a lot of foreign policy, for me, is the capacity to just look at somebody in the eye and tell them what I think and listen to what they think. It is finding that common ground, if possible, to solve problems. And sometimes you can solve problems by anticipating them and putting the conditions in place so that they will not arise in the first place. And sometimes they just show up, and you better be in a position to deal with them. Can I just clarify something? PERSON is-his theater-he is talked about the importance of GPE, talking about withdrawing our troops from GPE. That he is determined to-he has determined that the issue on Afghanistan- to keep troops in GPE. I view both GPE and GPE as theaters of the same war against radicals and extremists and look forward to sharing my views with Mr. PERSON, of course, and continue our discussions, strategic discussions with PERSON. My next question would touch on NORP cleric PERSON. As you might know, since he was released from jail, has been exercising activities like any other citizens, including recently-DATE he inaugurated a long march participated by CARDINAL of his followers, in connection with that commemoration, or welcoming DATE NORP fasting DATE. Actually, how close has your Government monitored the activities of PERSON? First of all, I did not know he led a parade of CARDINAL people. So that may answer your first question. I am sure our Embassy is aware of the activities that take place in your country. I mean, you are a free country where people are allowed to express themselves in the public square, which is a sign of a healthy society. I am concerned, however, about anybody who preaches violence and extremism and radicalism in a world in which innocent people just get simply murdered for ideological purposes. There were some terrible murders in your country, as you know, just like in mine, and I am confident that by far the vast majority-all of GPE rejects that kind of behavior. Innocent people were killed in GPE for no other reason than they just happened to be vacationing and because somebody wanted to send a political message because they are involved with this ideological struggle. And those of us who want there to be peace have got to reject this kind of behavior. And so your Government is a government of law; your Government will conduct itself according to your laws. But anybody who preaches that kind of violence in the name of what I would call a dark political vision needs to be taken seriously. My next question is about the GPE relationship and the war on terror. The opposition party in GPE is threatening to cut the extension of NORP participation in the antiterrorism operations in the Indian Ocean. Are you concerned about that? And will you be-will you raise this issue when you will meet Prime Minister PERSON in GPE? First of all, GPE has been a positive contributor to dealing with the extremists in this ideological war. And I thank ORG and the people of GPE for their contributions. And I would hope that they would continue to maintain this-their positive influence. And of course, my conversations with Prime Minister PERSON, whom I respect a great deal, will center on the war on terror, as well as a lot of other key issues. GPE has played a significant role in many of the things we have discussed here, like Proliferation Security Initiative, CARDINAL-party talks. They have been a constructive partner in peace, and I will-we will talk about all aspects of our relationship. ENTITY, DATE,GPE celebrates its 50th-- Fiftieth-make sure my congratulatory remarks get in your article. PERSON Congratulates GPE. Do you think that is what it will say? It also marks the 50th relations between the GPE and GPE So what are your outlook and hopes for GPE relations, and especially with GPE being the 10th largest trading partner? First of all, I do believe we ought to have-take this notion of trade and have meaningful discussions with a potential free trade agreement with GPE. Secondly, I respect Prime Minister PERSON, admire his leadership. When his wife died, I tried to call him early just to let him know I cared about him. I will congratulate him. Do not put that in the article, that you had to tell me that. You can put it in there if you want. I will be glad to-I am going to congratulate him. You did congratulate him. I am going to congratulate him again. I will double the congratulations. That is right; I did write him a note. Did I call him or write him a note? You wrote him a note. Anyway, GPE is an interesting example of how a free society can deal with movements that could conceivably change and alter the nature of the free society. And I respect the way the Prime Minister has used freedom and used the openness of society to kind of deal with frustration. I mean, all societies have frustrated people. And the question is, will the outlet of that frustration lead to violence or lead to peace? And GPE is an example of a country where frustrations have been channeled in a constructive way. And therefore, he is a leader, as far as I am concerned, and a very constructive force for Southeast Asia. By the way, I am going to meet with the ORG leaders, which is an important meeting as well. It is an opportunity for GPE to stay very much engaged with ORG. I unfortunately will not be there for the 60th, but look forward to having an event that would kind of recognize the importance of ORG as far as GPE is concerned. So this is a side meeting with the ORG leaders after ORG meeting, sir? I try to do that every time. So they will have somebody like-I will sit down and meet with the ORG nations as well. The other thing that is interesting about GPE is, they are going to be one of the leaders on alternative fuels. I believe that it is in our interests that we develop the technologies necessary to deal with energy dependence as well as greenhouse gases. Back to the climate changes-the way-if you are truly interested in dealing with greenhouse gases, people need to focus on the development of technologies that will enable us to, on the CARDINAL hand, grow our economies, on the other hand, be good stewards of the environment. Just for the record-and this probably will not be a headline, although I have tried to make it one a lot-when it comes time to climate change, there is CARDINAL major industrialized nation that actually grew its economy and reduced greenhouse gases; that would be GPE that actually had greenhouse gases go down and the economy go up. So something is working here, and it is technologies, use of technologies. And so I am going to be reminding people about-that we can come up with a strategy that does not impoverish our people and, at the same time, takes advantage of technologies. And we are going to need to share some technologies with newly emerging economies in order to achieve this objective. Anyway, I forgot to make that point. I am not making the point to you, as you can tell. That is why I am kind of looking over your shoulder. There appears to be a perception in Southeast Asia that this administration has neglected the region. How do you plan to convince them otherwise when you meet in ORG? Well, I-do you want to ask another question, because I already answered it. I will be glad to answer it again- which is, we have got strong bilateral-first of all, the number of trips I have taken- I have gone to every ORG meeting. I have spent a lot of time with leaders both here and in your respective countries-that we have got relations to a point where we can work together to solve common problems. PSI is CARDINAL such example of a strategy we have implemented to deal with the realities of the world. And so it is -the truth of the matter is, I spend a lot of time working on NORP matters. And all I will ask you to do is look at the results of the individual relationships and the ability to put processes in place to deal with the threats we live in and the capacity to work together to solve problems and to create opportunities. And to me, that is a sign of a healthy, robust relationship with an important part of the world.
