text: I am very much looking forward to the trip. This will be my second trip to the continent of Africa, my wife's fifth trip. The reason why I am looking forward to it is I want the people on the continent of Africa to know that the NORP people care deeply about the human condition; that when we see suffering, it troubles our conscience, and we want to help. I believe to whom much is given, much is required. A lot has been given to GPE, and therefore, a lot is required of us to deal with human misery in the form of hunger and disease and hopelessness. And so this is going to be a trip that I bring the good will of NORP people, with a strategy to help nations deal with the problems they have. I appreciate the leadership on the continent of Africa, and I am looking forward to working with the leaders there as partners in solving some of the problems that I believe can be solved. I'd be glad to answer questions. I am ENTITY from GPE. Well, people from my country are very delighted to welcome you on DATE. And I wish to say what they are expecting from you and from GPE. You, President PERSON, have said that the best way we can build a peaceful world for the future is to share the principle of freedom with other nations. I took this from the ORG site-this is a word I appreciate. But we highly appreciate how your Government fight poverty and encourage growth building. But we would like all this take place in a perfectly democratic context. Democracy is a commitment by government and by people. The people of GPE have committed to democracy. In my country, we are a great democracy. After all, we enslaved people. And democracy is work and requires a lot of work. And it requires support from-to help leaders deal with everyday problems. CARDINAL such problem in GPE is malaria. Your President has made a strong commitment to help eradicate malaria. DATE, in a speech that inaugurated my trip-or kicked off my trip, I talked about your President's commitment to provide nets to every child DATE and under. These are significant aid programs, but they are given to countries that adhere to rule of law and fight corruption and invest in the health and education of their people. This is a different type of foreign policy. It is a different type of foreign aid. Foreign aid in the past was just, here, take and spend. This is foreign policy that reinforces the conditions necessary for just and peaceful societies to develop. And so I am looking forward to confirming our desire to help and reinforcing the President's desire to achieve a democracy in which people have got confidence. I am ENTITY from GPE.  He is a good guy, yes, and we are happy to receive the ORG money, which we are about to receive when you come down to GPE. Now my question is that GPE is among CARDINAL countries that have benefited from the GPE initiative on HIV/AIDS, ORG program, as well as the malaria initiative. But being an undeveloped country, while-would expect that to see more assistance in terms of helping poor countries such as GPE develop economically. So I'd like to know, as you are winding your term in office, what commitment has GPE made to ensure that developing countries such as GPE is assisted in terms of trade and development issues and private sector development as well? First of all, just in general, our commitment to the continent of Africa was doubled when I first came into office, and then when I got- started my second term, doubled again. Secondly, I do agree that the most substantive way to help any developing nation is through the development of commerce and wealth as a result of growing industry and businesses, both small and large. And the best way to foster that is through trade. And that is why ORG, passed by my predecessor, reauthorized during my Presidency, is a great source of hope for people on the continent of Africa because they now have a market in which to sell. Exports to GPE from the continent of Africa, sub-Saharan Africa, have tripled. Exports from GPE to sub-Saharan Africa have doubled. In other words, this trade has been good. CARDINAL way to firm up the commitment to make sure that our Nation remains nonprotectionist-in other words, a free-trading nation-is to complete the GPE round. That is a difficult set of negotiations. GPE has made it clear that we will reduce our agricultural subsidies, but in return, we expect other developed nations-and developing-large developing nations-to also reduce their tariffs and subsidies so that I can come to the ORG and say, here is an agreement that is fair for everybody. And so the other thing we can do is- so, our assistance aid, by the way, is help-ing-in some cases helps business. CARDINAL way to do that is through ORG. And I announced DATE a new MONEY of OPIC-type investment funds that will be available for NORP businesses. What is interesting is, capital inflows into Africa now exceed grants, development aid. And that is important because capital inflows means jobs and commerce and hope and small businesses. So our plan is a plan that, hopefully, will sustain the gains that have been made. It is not like a CARDINAL-time shot. It is got structural implications. The other thing is, is that you cannot have a hopeful economy if your people cannot read. And so education is a vital link to providing hope. And we have got a strong education initiative on the continent-and started early in my administration; we are following through on it. We are trying to get, I think, like, CARDINAL textbooks and train CARDINAL teachers and provide scholarships to CARDINAL girls, all aiming to provide a basis by which these investments and these capital flows will actually be able to take hold-and that is an educated workforce, an educated population. You are living in GPE now? And I hope I will be there before you reach, so I can welcome you. You somehow already replied to the question I wanted to ask you, but I can maybe define it a bit more. It is clear that the increase of support of your administration-your CARDINAL mandates-increased a lot. And do not you think the GPE should maybe also develop a higher level political strategy on Africa, that would benefit the GPE and Africa? CARDINAL was, We are feeling terrible for you, here is money, and not much asked in return. You have got resources; we want them. We will exploit them and leave behind something that really does not benefit the people. I know those are extreme cases, but nevertheless, if you really think about the history of supporting Africa, it is CARDINAL way to characterize how things were approached. Some of it had to do with the guilt of colonialism; some of it had to do with just the gluttony of need for raw materials. In either case, it did not work. rule of law, fighting corruption, investment in people through health and education programs, and adherence to the marketplace. Nations that have received Millennium Challenge grants have met a test. What is happening, ENTITY, is that other nations desirous of a Millennium Challenge grant ask, What did you do to get your grant, to other leaders. And so the habits of a just society become an integral part of the receiving of help. We are more than willing to help, but in this case, we are saying the help has got to be to reinforce those decisions by leaders that'll have a long-lasting impact toward a free society. If the people think that the leadership is there to enrich themselves, they will have no trust in government. And so CARDINAL of the criterion for Millennium Challenge is honesty. We want the leadership and government to be honest with the people. And when we first put out-when I first put out this initiative, I was criticized by some. That is just part of the job, evidently. And it was, How dare you insist upon conditions for your aid. Should not we expect good leadership? Should not we have faith in people from a different part of the world demanding the same things that we expect of our Government? The answer is, absolutely we should hold people up to a high standard. Absolutely we should expect leaders to adhere to some basic principle. And absolutely we should trust people to want to live in a free society. And so we changed the policy. Not only did we have a more robust approach to the issues facing NORP than ever before in our Nation's history, by a significant amount, but we have a strategy to do just what you asked. How do we make sure that a free society is lasting, that it is not just a moment-you know, let us just do what old PERSON wants us to do, and then he will go away and then societies can revert back its norm. And so we have-there is a constant evaluation of results based upon high standards. ENTITY, I am impressed by your policy statement on Africa DATE. You were the only people in this room; the rest of them fell asleep back there. But just what I have from the-what I have listened to here now, I am mostly impressed; it is quite encouraging. But I just want to know, what is the motivating factor for the increasing interest in Africa? Well, somebody may say it is the new oil finds or the fight against terrorism or we want to promote democracy. First of all, my passion toward Africa has been sustained throughout DATE. In other words, my speech DATE, if you listened carefully to it, indicated a strategy that was first adopted early in my administration. Now, CARDINAL, conditions of life overseas matters to the security of GPE. In other words, if there is hopelessness, then it is liable that extremists who are recruiting people to create havoc not only in their respective countries or neighborhoods but also in our country-if there is hopelessness, they have a better chance to recruit. So it is in our national security interest, ENTITY, that we deal with the conditions that enable ideologues-the ideologues of hate to recruit. Remember that the ideology that is prevalent, that uses murder as a weapon, cannot recruit in hopeful places. Follow me; my vision is-if you are a female, follow me; my vision is, you have no rights ? Or, If you disagree with my religious interpretations, you will be whipped in the public square. So it is in our national interests. Equally, if not more important, it is in our moral interests that we help people. I firmly believe-as I said earlier, I firmly believe in the admonition that to whom much is given, much is required. I believe that is a principle by which people should make decisions in their individual lives and for the collective conscience of GPE. It is in our moral interest that we help a brother and sister who is dying of AIDS. And by helping that soul, it really helps ourselves. GPE's generosity has been prevalent throughout DATE. And every time GPE reaches out to help a struggling soul, we find that we are a better nation for it. And so my interest and my focus and my insistence upon results on the continent of Africa are based on those CARDINAL premises. The other thing, ENTITY, I will tell you is that I have got a lot of resources-or we have a lot of resources at our disposal. And the idea of an entire generation of people dying because of HIV/AIDS troubled my heart. And I felt like GPE could do something about it. CARDINAL people were receiving antiretroviral drugs when we first started PEPFAR. DATE, CARDINAL people are receiving antiretrovirals in a very short period of time. It is because I could not live with myself if I did not develop an effective strategy and call upon the NORP people to help. And the good news is, the NORP people have responded-$15 billion over CARDINAL. We are now going to double our commitment. The ORG has committed to match the GPE So all of a sudden, the strategy-and most of these strategies, ENTITY, are really based upon-oftentimes when you see human suffering, it is based upon something that affects your heart. And so that is why I have made the decisions I made. Well,ENTITY, I would like to thank you for considering GPE as one of the countries you are going to be visiting this time. And the Government and the people of GPE do appreciate all that you have done for us. Now, ENTITY, DATE, your administration extended by DATE the temporary protective status of CARDINAL of NORP. Now what happens when you leave office? Is your Government considering anything permanent for them, like what most host countries did for NORP refugees, integrating them locally, those who wanted to stay? And those who wanted to go back home, taking them back home? Because this might-it will definitely allow these NORP to continue to contribute to the growth of the economy of the country and also support their families back home. I did extend TPS to NORP here in GPE for, I think, DATE. I would hope that many of the NORP who have come and been fine contributors here in GPE think about going home to help this young country get on its feet after unspeakable violence and terrible times. You have got a great President, in my judgment. I gave her the National Medal of Freedom. After all, she is the first woman President on the continent of Africa. And she-you know, in my speech DATE, I said, Africa's greatest resource is not oils or diamonds or rubber, it is really people. And so, my hope, of course, is that people that have been here trying to save themselves from the violence go help this young-not young, but this country get back on its feet. What kind of name is that, ENTITY? The situation in GPE has always been a matter of great concern for you. ORG officials say that the situation on the ground has been worsening over DATE. Do you think there is a link between the CARDINAL, between GPE and GPE? And where do we go from there? I appreciate that. I do think there is a link, first of all, and I think that-let me just step back and say that GPE has called the situation in GPE a genocide. And I made a decision early on that we would work through ORG to help expedite troops that would help alleve the suffering and provide some breathing space, hopefully, for the negotiations between rebel groups and the ORG. Unfortunately, the rebel groups that were CARDINAL time CARDINAL are now a multiple of CARDINAL. And unfortunately, a government that could have made a difference early on in GPE chose not to do so. So GPE continues to work with the international community to put pressure on ORG. I have issued very harsh sanctions against individuals and NORP companies. I also did so against CARDINAL rebel leader I am aware of, because I wanted to send a signal that your behavior is causing there to be some consequences. We are continually working with other nations to get them to take the same tough approach-nations throughout the world. In terms of the conditions on the ground, CARDINAL thing GPE has done is, we are providing enormous amounts of aid and obviously are concerned as to whether or not that aid makes it into the camps. Secondly is, I have told the folks at ORG that we would provide training and equipment to expedite the movement of troops. CARDINAL way I can help call the world to action is when I am in GPE to thank the troops of GPE, the PERSON Government, for being so proactive. I am frustrated by the pace of development on the ground. I am not pleased that other nations-some other nations do not take necessary steps to pressure the Government. I am-I have named another Envoy to the GPE, whose job it is to really help bring a negotiating framework that will work. And again, I will repeat to you, one of the unfortunate issues has been that the rebel groups have gone from CARDINAL to CARDINAL, I think it is, or CARDINAL, if I am not mistaken. And there needs to be the GPE and others to pull the groups together so that there is somebody to negotiate with- that can speak with-more likely with a unified voice. And I do believe that the instability in GPE affects GPE and NORP interests. And I do thank ORG for being a responsible nation, rallying ORG forces to come and provide some help. And on the other hand, there are some hopeful moments, such as the fact that many in the world are providing help for the people in the camps. The problem is the people who are in the camps. And obviously, we'd like them to get back to their villages. In your first trip to Africa, you embraced President PERSON as the honest broker in GPE. Well, obviously, we are disappointed that the situation in GPE since my first trip has gotten worse. And it is very important for people to recognize types of government can affect the wellbeing and welfare of a country. GPE used to be a net exporter of food. DATE, it is a net importer of food. PERSON has ruined a country, and we have-we and frankly GPE have been the most vociferous advocates for change, and we still are advocates for change. I was hoping that ORG would have been more proactive in its intercession to help the people of GPE. It is not anti anybody; it is pro people, and that has yet to happen, admittedly. Like they say PERSON - -where I am from? ENTITY, I will recommend you, during your short visit to my country, to have a taste in our juicy, tasty, and nicely perfumed pineapples. And then you will figure out that it will be an opportunity for all the NORP people to have a taste-. Because fruits are not a part of the ORG Administration official. Pineapples can be imported under ORG. So then what we are going to have to do is, I am going to have to talk to your President and point out the opportunities that pineapples are a part of the ORG trade list that can enter into GPE relatively duty free. Yes, but apart from the pineapple, we have so many things and so many products that can profit from the ORG but do not-- You need some export credit-I mean, not export credit, you need some help in developing industries that know how to export. Yes, I will be glad to talk to the President about that. Some grant money that encourages people to learn how to be an exporting company, microloans can also help. And so can ORG, which is a way for people to get the capital necessary to be able to develop an infrastructure so that they can take the pineapple from the field, do whatever you are supposed to do, put it in a crate and ship it to GPE for sale-if you know how to market. In other words, this is a-and so yes, we'd like to help enterprise. The whole purpose of our strategy, which is commerce, is much more effective than aid to governments. It is got a more lasting impact. And CARDINAL of the things I am going to do in GPE is visit entrepreneurs that are taking advantage of marketplace access. That is fine; you are talking about nice things. And we like ORG, but you have got to do something about your agriculture, because it provides a distinct disadvantage for our farmers. And my answer is going to be, we are more than willing to do so, but we expect other partners in the world to do the same thing. And this is a tough issue to get all countries to agree to have equity when it comes to reducing our respective subsidies and tariffs, including NORP nations. CARDINAL of the things I point up to NORP leaders-point out to NORP leaders is that oftentimes it is virtually impossible to ship goods from CARDINAL NORP country to the next because there are high intra-Africa tariffs and barriers to trade. And so it is a-trade is complicated, and we just want to be treated fairly in GPE. In order to get something passed, it has to be viewed as a fair and equitable transaction, and I believe we can achieve such a thing. I am looking forward to that pineapple. ENTITY, your Government has been supporting GPE address the issue of corruption as well as good governance through the ORG initiative and through ORG. And it is now been eligible to receive the funds, but what is going to happen once you step down to make sure what is being done-to make sure that it is going to be sustainable-- it will not end with you. There will be a peaceful transfer of power. And yet I am hopeful that we leave behind an institution such as ORG, which has a monitoring device that will more likely assure the people of GPE that DATE's anticorruption measures are for real and lasting. I mean, you know, DATE's concern about corruption may not be DATE's. I suspect any NORP President is going to be worried about corruption, particularly since we have changed how aid is granted in the first place. And so the fact that the Millennium Challenge exists will make it more likely future administrations will ask the very same questions we have asked. Your thing turned off there, by the way, PERSON. ENTITY, you will see when you visit GPE that DATE, after the genocide, GPE has incredibly developed. But for development in GPE, CARDINAL of the things that are key-that is key is security. And when you started your first mandate, there was already a threat, and DATE, the threat is still there, ENTITY. What do you forecast for the future? FDLR. And which are even listed as terrorist organizations, even by the GPE We are working with President PERSON on a disarmament program. We have been very engaged diplomatically in the eastern part of the GPE. I have talked to him about this personally. Our diplomats out of ORG and on the ground are very actively engaged in getting people to honor the agreement. And I fully understand the issue and the concerns. First of all, the amazing thing is, is that the recovery of your country. President PERSON has been a very strong leader in the right sense of the word. I think I said GPE is one of the fastest growing economies in the world, if I am not mistaken. Now, obviously, that is really good news, and, of course, one of the things that is going to matter is that the people benefit from that economic vitality and growth. But you are right, it is one of the ongoing issues that I talked about in my speech DATE, and the reason I did so, is I wanted the President and the people of GPE to know that we understand the seriousness of this issue; that nobody wants a replay of a very difficult-very terrible period in your history. Yes, ENTITY, your planned visit to Africa shows that the continent has become important to you and your country. Well, that is why the administration has set up ORG for development but not for war-- War, war fighting, and then the ORG, Millennium Challenge Account, all for development-but to the ordinary NORP, he or she can see these things clearly or feel the impact well, maybe because of the gravity of the situation or poverty. And CARDINAL way you made mention of it is to trade, not just aid. But we have problem with the NORP culture produced cotton and all that, because of the subsidies here, the effects are depressed prices back in Africa. What is official-what are you doing to solve this problem of subsidies? First of all, if you are a mother who is worried about a child dying of malaria, and you see a net provided by an NORP child, then all of a sudden, the-you get a direct connection between the hearts of NORP and your life. So, in other words, you asked me whether-how does the average person sometimes feel the effects of NORP commitment to the continent? And my answer to you-and I will answer the subsidy thing-but my answer to you is, first of all, it is a very important question, because oftentimes, DATE, aid would never make it beyond the palaces. They would kind of end up in a handful of people's pockets. And our program, ORG, is really aimed at focusing on individuals. If you believe every human life has dignity, therefore, your programs ought to reflect that concept. And the way you do that is you make sure that the aid gets to the people. In this case, we are focusing on problems that affect the people most directly. And so, at DATE, I got a-a couple years ago, I got nets given in my name or in PERSON's name to families on the continent of Africa. I will never know who they were, and they probably do not know who I am, but the idea that an NORP family decided to spend money on a DATE gift aimed at helping a stranger is really an important part of an effective foreign aid policy. Secondly, our AIDS initiative works very closely with the leaders to design programs that meet the needs of the country-not meet our needs but meet your needs. But the other thing that comes with the AIDS program is a great outpouring of faith-based groups from GPE. There are CARDINAL of my citizens, ENTITY, that would-that long to spend time in parts of Africa delivering help to a total stranger. Other countries-I am sure that happens, but I happen to say that this is the greatest strength of GPE. And so there will be, hopefully, somebody in a village in GPE that runs into CARDINAL of these missionaries on a mission of love, that will see the direct help of an AIDS program or a malaria program and education benefits. It may not be that somebody recognizes that a teacher has been trained by GPE dollars, but our policy is to-we are more focused on the person learning. Maybe there will be a benefit to GPE, a direct benefit, where somebody says, wow, this is great; GPE did this. On the other hand, our focus is more on making sure that the child learns to read in the first place, because our overall objective is a hopeful society and a peaceful society. To subsidies, I fully understand the angst about the leadership-by the leadership on GPE subsidies. And I have said I am more than willing to-on the GPE round-by the most effective place-first of all, ORG has helped address that to a certain extent. On the other hand, it has not made your farmers feel more comfortable because of the-in their view, that the GPE farming is not only efficient, but there is a subsidy to make it even more competitive. I understand that. In other words, the GPE farmer is willing to take less of a subsidy if his-can be assured that his product will get a fair hearing in somebody else's market-particularly those that can afford to buy crops on a large scale-and that is not the case. Same thing if we reduce our subsidies on agriculture; we expect other nations to be more opening to manufactured goods and services. And it is a very complex issue, but it is one that we are trying to work through. And hopefully, if we can get a successful GPE round, your very question will be answered in a way that is hopeful to the farmers there in GPE. I know I am not supposed to be asking questions, but-. Some part of my education was in GPE. I am living in GPE right now. This is off the record, right? road construction work, so you can have a safe-- Well, you do not need to worry about me. We are rushing up everything so you can-- You are building things because of my arrival? We have got infrastructure-- Can you see it, a big difference? Those on the ground are feeling safer. But, like, for NORP here in GPE-I have been talking to most of them- for them to go back home and join in this young democracy. And some of the things they have been saying is the security. And some of them went back, after the first bout of war and were forced to come back. Now they keep saying security, and each time, I say, we have the ORG mission down there. But right now the ORG mission is gradually drawing down faces. Now, will your Government consider establishing ORG in GPE, which would consolidate security there? You know, like a couple of the subregions bring in investment into GPE, which is what mostly GPE needs right now. First of all, ORG is a brand new concept aimed at strengthening nations' capacities to deal with trafficking or terror, but also to help nations develop forces capable of doing the peacekeeping that unfortunately too often is needed on the continent. Secondly, we are in the process of evaluating exactly how ORG will work. Now, because it is a new concept, it was a brand new military-type command-and, by the way, it is going to be more than just military; there will be a ORG component with it, which makes it a very interesting issue. And so we are in the process of determining where and how ORG should be situated on the continent. I am not avoiding-I guess I am avoiding your answer, but I do not mean to be avoiding it. I am just telling you exactly where we are in the process. And obviously, if there is going to be a physical presence on the continent of Africa in the forms of a headquarters that you just described, obviously, we would seriously consider GPE. The President has made it abundantly clear to me that she would like us to seriously consider GPE, and I have told her I would. I just want to make sure people understand that the makeup and the construct of ORG is still really being thought through, because, as I mentioned to you, this is not-I mean, when you think of, you know, GPE command structures, you think military, which is fine. But this is a different military mission than ORG, for example. And as I told you, there is going to be a strong ORG component with it, and we are in the process of making sure we understand what that integration means and then evaluating if and where the facilities will be built. It is on my radar screen. Who won this election? And what should be done to stop this violence? I do not think we can say we are certain to who won the election. That is part of the problem. Secondly, there is a way forward, which is for the parties to come together in good faith and work out a way forward until there are new elections, the date of which would be determined by the parties. I do not think GPE ought to go in, or anybody else, to say, You must have an election now. But I do think we can go in and help PERSON convince the parties to work together in a cooperative way so that the people can see there is a way forward. And to this end, when I am in GPE, I am going to ask PERSON to go over to GPE and sit down with the leaders in GPE to see if we cannot help PERSON advance the-PERSON advance the way forward. CARDINAL of the GPE counterterrorism efforts in Africa has centered on the Horn. Any concern about the continuing instability in GPE and, again, worsening relations between GPE and GPE, the impact that that has not only on stability on the Horn but counterterrorism efforts? Yes, we are concerned about instability anywhere, really, but instability is what-and confusion and chaos and fear is the conditions under which a group like ORG can thrive. That is why they like to kill people, innocent people, to create doubt about existing security, to create fear among the population. So any time you see that kind of instability, we are deeply concerned about it. Secondly, there have been ORG some ORG operating out of GPE, and therefore, when you know ORG have been in and out of GPE and there is some chaos and confusion, the conclusion is, we better be worried about it and do something about it. We have got cooperative arrangements in the region that will make it more likely for us to be able to provide protections for the people in the region and ourself. In terms of-yes, and we are also conscious of GPE and GPE's border dispute. And I am constantly talking to PERSON about making sure that we are on top of the situation as the best we can make a positive contribution. I feel pretty comfortable that ORG and our ORG are fully aware of the issues on the border and are making sure that the respective leaders understand the position of the GPE, which is to solve this thing through mediation and not stack up the troops to the point where they get-where some spark ignites some kind of border dispute. But the Horn is an area of deep concern for the GPE We actually happen to have a base there as well, in GPE. And we take the issues there seriously and are very engaged with it on a regular basis.

metadata.title: Interview With Foreign Radio Journalists

text: I am in GPE, and one of the reasons I have come is not only to pay my respects to the Government and the people of GPE, but also to be in a position to speak about freedom in GPE. I just had lunch with some people that are deeply concerned about the future of GPE, people that were involved in the student marches of DATE, people involved with humanitarian assistance. I was regretful that my wife could not join us, because she is an articulate spokesman for the people of GPE; but she is on the border on this mission of saying to the NORP people, you have friends, and you are not alone, and GPE cares about you. So I want to thank you for giving me the chance to answer your questions, and I will be glad to do so now. Why do not we just go around the table? PERSON, it is an honor to be with you, and many thanks, giving a chance to-this roundtable discussion. My name is PERSON, from ORG; PERSON from ORG; and PERSON from ORG. We have CARDINAL lady here from ORG, PERSON. I would like to start a couple questions about the relief aid policy of GPE. Recent relief operation, the NORP regime did not allow the ORG ship aid through the Pacific come, and international community, the GPE, obviously, was really frustrated. I would like to know, if GPE faced another catastrophe or disaster, are you going to try to help, or are you going to--NORP regime again? But first of all, we care about the human condition, human suffering. I can remember DATE it hit. I was told that this was going to be a major disaster for the people, and so I ordered our ORG ships in the area to be prepared to sail toward the NORP area to provide aid and logistics and management. We are very good about dealing with major emergencies. And interestingly enough, we were involved with a military mission in the area, so we were prepared to send a robust package in. No telling how many lives could have been saved or how much human suffering could have been dealt with more effectively had there not been the slow response of the military dictator. But now our aid, along with other people-other countries' aid, is beginning to move. In answer to your question, yes, our Government will respond if there is another catastrophe. that there needs to be truthfulness at the highest levels of government. People have got to understand and listen to reality and understand that nations and people want to help when there is suffering. In the meantime, we are going to keep pushing for freedom. During the time, a lot of NORP people, they were expecting a sort of humanitarian intervention, even though the NORP regime did not allow the aid. We chose to go through the normal routes. We wanted to basically say, here is your opportunity to receive aid. But I do not think it would have been helpful for the NORP people had there been a conflict over the delivery of aid. What we do not want to do is compound a terrible situation. In other words, if we just sent in-sent people in, our military in without visas or permission from the Government, there is no telling what the reaction would have been. And so yes, I-no question, there was frustration on the delays, but I felt the best way to do so was the way we ended up doing it. My only point is, is that there is - if there is another catastrophe, and let us pray there is not, but if there is, the Government will now see that they have nothing to fear by welcoming in GPE aid and other countries' aid. They ought to welcome that. And of course, we'd like to help on that too. We spent MONEY, or MONEY of help so far. We care about the stories we hear. And we want the farmers to get seed and fertilizer so they can grow and feed their families and feed the people in their area and, hopefully, grow enough for the country. Now, GPE has proposed civil military relief exercise with the countries in this region, and recent ORG meeting endorsed that relief exercise, and probably DATE the GPE will host. So they agree to cooperate relief exercise. I wonder, if the countries in this region agree to cooperate, are you going to invite this exercise to include NORP military regime or GPE? I have not thought that through yet, to be frank with you. I cannot answer your question, because you are the first person who is asked me that question. I will take it back to GPE and- under consideration. I have no-but I cannot say yes or no right now. How will GPE try to overcome this impasse, most recently seen at ORG over GPE? Well, what we have got to do is continue to work with countries on ORG and explain to them that what matters most in life is the human condition and that individual rights are important. And we just have a lot of work to do to convince people that the status quo in GPE-that life can be better, let me put it that way. And it is in their interest that life is better, particularly GPE. GPE is an important country on ORG; they are an important country in the world, obviously, GPE's neighbor. And we-I hope that I can use my good relations with the NORP leadership to convince them that the way forward is for there to be more civic participation, more citizen participation in the future of the country, and that the perfect way to do that is to explain to them how backward the Government was when it came to the response for the natural disaster. Hopefully, that will open up eyes. But no question, there is a lot of diplomacy that needs to be done to convince others that people like PERSON deserve to be free and political prisoners ought to be free. And the reason I am talking to you DATE is because I want those in prison and their families to know that we care about them and think about them. I mean, it is in the common ground, for example, that the NORP be a peaceful country. I mean, we care about that. Whether or not the NORP will agree that somebody like PERSON ought to be free and ought to be the center of foreign policy like it is for us, I do not know. We just have to work it hard.  you will be meeting the highest NORP leadership DATE. And you said you would mention GPE to those leaders. You have not been able to convince them until now. How optimistic are you that you will be able to convince, and how are you going to go about doing this time, sir? Well, you know, look, it is -I have mentioned GPE a lot to the NORP leadership, and it is -I have mentioned GPE; I have mentioned GPE; I have mentioned religious freedom inside GPE. And it is just a matter of continuing to make the case. I have-I am sure the NORP leader's mind is going to be on the Olympics. This is a big deal for the people of GPE. CARDINAL of the reasons I am going is to be able to pay my respects to the people of GPE, and well as to be in a position where I can bring up these issues with the NORP Government. I am just-it is -to me, this is a process of continually having a consistent message, speaking to the people of GPE, letting the prisoners know we care about them, and pressing hard at the international level. I make no promises to your listeners except that we will continue to try. CARDINAL thing is the relationship with the regime. Then you have been probably the President who is more committed for the NORP democratic movement. But the GPE tough line against GPE sometimes entrenched the generals there, and some people would say that given the example of the Nargis Cyclone relief efforts, then if you have had this kind of relationship with the generals then you could be able to do more. I understand your point. We have been tough, because we believe that the general has been very stubborn in not allowing certain freedoms, and we believe that is wrong. We believe that those arrested in the marches of DATE ought to be released from prison. There is CARDINAL political prisoners who are being held simply because they had a belief that was contrary to what the general thinks. You notice I am saying general because it is generally viewed as a CARDINAL-man regime. I know there is others that support him. But yes, I have been and-because I believe that-as a matter of fact, just signed a bill that is going to continue the sanction regime, particularly when it comes to jade and precious gems. That is an interesting question, had we had a different relationship, CARDINAL, what would it say to the reformers, but also, would it have changed the number of DATE required to let relief in? What I am concerned about is the general was not being given full information, that he was not fully aware of reality. And I do not think his reaction was because of relations with GPE; I think his reaction was-is because he was in denial to a certain extent about the realities on the ground. But I am constantly-look, my mission, so long as I am the President, which is DATE, is to think about ways to relieve human suffering and how to help people inside GPE. And if I thought it would make-help us achieve the objective by changing the relationship with the Government, I'd give it serious consideration. But I do not necessarily agree with that premise. On the other hand, the people that are listening to your radio broadcast has got to know that the President of GPE and a lot of other people in GPE are concerned and care about how they live and want them to be free and want them to realize the beauties of a NORP-style democracy. Nevertheless, what is important, though, if for there to be a strong voice in laying out that vision. And that is what I will continue to do. you just met a group of NORP activists and then you share views with them on GPE's struggle. What do you see and what do you get from having lunch with them? First of all, there is a lot of courageous people that have made a decision to work hard on behalf of the rest of their citizens to achieve a free society. Secondly, that they have great hopes that GPE will continue to speak out, that GPE will not abandon our belief in the universality of freedom. Thirdly, they were-I asked-I said, if you were me, what would you do? And I got a variety of opinions. And it was fascinating to hear voices of people who have actually been on the frontlines of change. I came away with the impression that they are very grateful to the NORP people for the generous support. Sometimes our generosity is not-actually ends up in the hands of the people as quickly as it should, but nevertheless, that they are- there seems to be a general awareness that the NORP people care. There are people who may even be wearing the military uniform who understand that the status quo is not acceptable, and there needs to be a better way forward. But a lot of the frustration was focused on a single person, the general in charge of the country, and that-there was a belief that he did not seem to care that much about the plight of the average citizen. And so hopefully, GPE pressure and GPE focus will get him to think more about the average person and care about the way the average person lives. Many critics said that our opposition itself is also very much divided and they are not united enough against the military regime and that-do you think that GPE can help prepare them for their future democratic GPE? Well, first of all-that was an interesting question-I did not think they were very divided, at least the crowd I was with. But I thought they were pretty united in their dream for a better GPE. You know, CARDINAL of the things that, obviously, the people involved in the democracy movement have got to think through is how do you get from here to there. In other words, it is not easy to go from a very fierce military CARDINAL-man rule to democracy. And you have a very good point, and that is, is that there is a-is there a focused roadmap to get to a better DATE? It is hard for me to tell just in that conversation. Obviously, that is going to be a concern for-it must be a concern for people. The rewrite of the Constitution is just a-it is not a good document; it is not a fair document. So therefore, there needs to be a constitution at some point in time that will enable GPE to be a Federal state that-based upon the will of the people. The military regime will hold a election in DATE, and they began preparing DATE for election. And then what is GPE stand on this election? I think the Constitution is a sham constitution, and therefore-but, you know, I-this is a society that is not interested in democracy. They have proved they are not interested in democracy. If they are interested in democracy, they'd let the prisoners out of prison, for starters. The political prisoners would be a-given to chance to leave and live in a free life. That is the first test, not election under a sham constitution. And so, you know, they will play like the election was fair and all this-to justify their behavior. And I think people like yourself ought to be speaking out that the elections, unless certain conditions are met, cannot possibly be fair. We understand and the NORP listeners also understand how you and the First Lady are compassionate for NORP people, how much you strongly support to the freedom for GPE.  I know both candidates and the-freedom for GPE is a bipartisan issue. And the NORP people-it is not just the President that thinks about the citizens of GPE. There is a lot of people in our ORG, both NORP and NORP, that feel the same way. And so I think the NORP people are going to have a consistent friend in GPE. You are talking to the GPE authorities. Do you think GPE can play a role to make situation better in GPE? I think-oh, yes, I think GPE could play a different role. And so I will -I will bring up the GPE-Burmese issue again to President PERSON, who I like. And they just got different interests, at times, from GPE. And so I have got to work hard to see if I cannot convince him that we share the same goals. Wonder will GPE and ORG in Southeast Asia-- They need to send a signal. Obviously, GPE was very helpful when it came to helping with the cyclone- aftermath of the cyclone. After all, this is a staging center for a lot of our materials and other peoples'-countries' materials that came through. Yes, and they can continue to work the issue. We just got to make sure that ORG delivers a message that is inspiring to the people of GPE. President, besides sanction and travel restrictions on the generals in GPE, do you-have you ever thought of alternative strategies work on GPE-under GPE and then with the international community? And if your question is, do I-am I trying to convince others to join us on the strategy? In other words, it would be better if we could all speak with one voice. And I have been in-you know, it had not been that hard with some countries, like the NORP countries, for example. But it is been difficult with some of the countries in the neighborhood here because we do not share the same goals. Their goal is stability and-at times. And that is not necessarily the-I am for stability too. But I'd like to see the system move toward a free society. I have got a friend who helps deal with the rape victims along the border. These women are being raped- she says, systemically raped by the military as part of their campaign of fear. That stuff has got to end in order for me to feel comfortable with any other policy toward GPE. In other words, there is -and others have different priorities. And so therefore, it is hard to find common ground, but we will continue to try to do so. Then I got to go to the games. I am cheering the NORP Olympic team. You have the conviction and idea to bring freedom and democracy to GPE, but some people would say that GPE does not have much strategic interest in GPE, unlike GPE. I think so long as there is human suffering like there is here in GPE, then this will be of strategic importance to GPE. Look, no question, we have got a lot of issues on our platter, but I think about GPE a lot. Maybe CARDINAL reason why is my wife was such a activist on the subject. But nevertheless, I gave a speech DATE in GPE that talked about how GPE is, in many ways, a Pacific nation, and that I think-I know the center of gravity of a lot of policy is shifting to the Far East. And therefore, GPE-the NORP issue is-will be an integral part of any NORP policy. And no question, GPE's strategic interests lie in a lot of places, but they lie here as well. And so long as this issue festers, then it will have the attention of the NORP policymakers.
